text:
I was just debugging a test and noticed that for large counter values, the
counter pre-processor doesn't work properly. Specifically, the value I was
testing with had a start value of 70,000 incrementing from 1 to 100. What the
counter did however, was simply give me a value of 70,001 on every loop. 

I verified the high number was the problem by changing my start value to '1' and
it worked as expected.

Ideally, it would be nice to have the Counter work as expected for large values,
but if that's not possible, then the documentation (Component Reference Section
18.7.6 - Counter) should be updated to reflect the limit.
creator: jmeter@binarytwo.com

text:
The counter uses an int currently, so the maximum should be: 

Integer.MAX_VALUE = 2^^31-1 = 2,147,483,647

Works for me using Start=70000 - are you sure you specified a suitable maximum?

Agreed the limit should be documented - downgrading to minor.
creator: sebb@apache.org
mstover1@apache.org
text:
How do you start at 70,000 and then proceed to increment from 1 to 100??  I'm
confused - I'm not surprised JMeter is too.  Sounds like non-sensical input.

creator: jmeter@binarytwo.com
text:
Yes, I've realized that I had the counter incorrectly configured using those
inputs. I was thinking of the Maximum field as the number of counter iterations
rather than the Maximum counter value.

ie, start at 70k, increment by 1, go to 100 when it should have been start at
70k, increment by 1, go to 70,100.

I think still that the limits for counter values should be stated somewhere.
(either in the docs or on the counter component)
Updated component reference with details of range.
creator: sebb@apache.org
